ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own it 	 yet...
ygData.msgSnippet: I m sorry for all of those out there that are unable to afford an upgrade. I prefer that Verant provide the best product they can to compete with other online
ygData.messageBody:
I'm sorry for all of those out there that are unable to afford an upgrade.
I prefer that Verant provide the best product they can to compete with other
online gaming systems. And in all respects they have keep the requirements
of the game a minimum. If you don't have a system that capable of using the
software at its fullest extent.. That's ok you don't have to in order to
play the expansion. There are a number of options and switches to lessen
the burden on your system and still enjoy the game like everyone else. All
those that say well I can't afford the upgrade so I will switch to DAoC or
AO.. Good luck 1) you have to buy the game. 2) you have to pay $12.50 a
month to play. 3) what are you going to do when those games decide to
upgrade to DirectX 8?

Some people like to make it difficult on themselves.. /sigh

-----Original Message-----
From: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 12, 2001 9:40 AM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own it
yet...



Some people can't even play the old everquest anymore with the intro of dx8.
I can play it just fine with my system but I feel bad for other people. And
I would hate to be in the same position as them. luv, -Su

> If that's the direction you want to take.. Well all I can say is you
> won't be able to play any future games anyways until you do a minimum
> upgrade to your system. Like it or not, it's a fact. Get a 30$ video
> card and play the old everquest.. If ya cant afford that then ya can
> afford the
expansion
> software itself.
>
> Ah well.. :(
>
> -----Original Message-----

> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] I hate Shadows of Luclin and I don't even own

>

>
> Well, some people can barely afford the computers they have as well as

their
> customers to upgrade or quit. luv, -Su
>
> > Hardware is fairly inexpensive these days. If your into computers
> > and
> games
> > in particular you will have to stay slightly ahead of the curve.
> Currently
> > you can pick up memory pretty cheap.. I got mine from
> > googlegear.com..
> They
> > have 512megs of memory for as low as 60$ Keep in mind that only a
> > few
> years
> > ago that could have cost you up to 1$ per meg. Besides they
> > released the requirements for Luclin months ago, there was time to
> > upgrade prior. You can still certainly play the previous Everquest
> > as well as the prior expansions without changing much if anything..
> > If it's the directx 8 problem, you can pick up compatiable cards
> > (geforce2 MXs) for as low as
> 35$.

> will
> > work. There is not the slightest chance in hell you can install
> > luclin on that machine tho, cause it will die while trying to render
> > the new
> graphics.
> >
> > And you should really get more ram, it isnt that expensive. Ram and
> > a nice video card and everything works a lot smoother. CPU power
> > isnt that important.
> >
> > 512mb for $100 isnt steep. And your machine needs to be nicely
> > configured. For example if you run WinXP old world eq and me would
> > be like 256 megs to run ok but on 98 128 works ok and 160 is fine.
> >
> > And dont be so negative, SoL is a whopping expansion worth the new
> > specs. Graphics are cool (some char models are a bit weird) but
> > mobs/surrondings are very nice. The mob features are a LOT improved
> > adding more tactics to fights.
> >
> > /Alex
